channel.title: Morning Score
channel.description: Delivered every Monday by 10 a.m., Weekly Score is your guide to the year-round campaign cycle.

item.title: Where Democrats’ House primaries stand
item.description: Across at least 10 battleground House seats nationwide, Democrats are sitting with similar cash-on-hand totals.
item.dc:creator: By Andrew Howard

item.title: The big ads from the big game
item.description: While most ads were from the biggest companies in the world, some politicians, too, used the couch-heavy affair to promote their campaigns.
item.dc:creator: By Andrew Howard

item.title: 5 things we learned from the latest FEC drop
item.description: Candidates, committees and super PACs filed with the FEC on Saturday night.
item.dc:creator: By Andrew Howard

item.title: Independents think it’s their year (again)
item.description: Two more independents — Alaska’s Bill Hill and Wisconsin’s Mike Thurow — launched campaigns last week.
item.dc:creator: By Andrew Howard

item.title: Where Trump’s efforts to change elections stand
item.description: Trump remains fixated on his 2020 election defeat.
item.dc:creator: By Andrew Howard

item.title: Where the redistricting fight goes next
item.description: Two states — Florida and Virginia — remain the most likely to redraw before the midterms.
item.dc:creator: By Andrew Howard

item.title: 5 big questions for this year’s midterms
item.description: 2026 will provide major tests for both parties.
item.dc:creator: By Andrew Howard
